title: Team
text:
Role










Role

title: Urban Research Station
text:
By 20250, nearly 70% of people will live in cities
We study how we can make cities better places for people and for nature.
Our vision is of a future where both people and planet thrive.


30 years of research
In 2025 we will have been studying the Museum’s gardens for thirty years. Regular biodiversity surveys by Museum staff and others make it one one of the most intensively studied urban sites worldwide.








A living laboratory
Our gardens are a place where we experiment with new techniques and evaluate new methodologies to better understand how we can restore biodiveristy and create resilient ecosystems.
Our gardens and research infrastructres are open to Museum staff and external collaborators for research and teaching.


Training the next generation
Some text.








Integrating diverse datasets
Data ecosystem


Leading change
SKENZEN
Something on policy.

title: Case Studies
text:
Environmental monitoring sensors throughout the Nature Discovery Garden collecting real-time data on various environmental parameters.










Using eDNA sampling to detect and monitor biodiversity through genetic material analysis in environmental samples.










Regular moth trapping surveys to monitor lepidopteran diversity and abundance, contributing to long-term biodiversity monitoring.










Standardized bird transect surveys to monitor avian diversity and abundance throughout the year.










Weekly butterfly transect surveys following UK Butterfly Monitoring Scheme protocols to monitor butterfly populations.

title: Moth Trapping
text: Regular moth trapping surveys are conducted in the Nature Discovery Garden to monitor lepidopteran diversity and abundance, contributing to long-term biodiversity monitoring efforts.

title: Moth Trapping
text: Regular moth trapping surveys are conducted in the Nature Discovery Garden to monitor lepidopteran diversity and abundance, contributing to long-term biodiversity monitoring efforts.

title: Moth Trapping
text:
Objectives

Monitor moth species diversity and abundance
Track seasonal and annual population changes
Identify rare or notable species
Contribute to citizen science and public engagement

title: MAARU - Autonomous Spatial Audio Recorders
text: MAARU (Autonomous Spatial Audio Recorders) is a collaboration focused on deploying autonomous audio recording devices to monitor soundscapes and wildlife acoustic activity in the Nature Discovery Garden.

title: MAARU - Autonomous Spatial Audio Recorders
text: MAARU (Autonomous Spatial Audio Recorders) is a collaboration focused on deploying autonomous audio recording devices to monitor soundscapes and wildlife acoustic activity in the Nature Discovery Garden.

title: MAARU - Autonomous Spatial Audio Recorders
text:
Objectives

Monitor acoustic environments and soundscapes
Detect and identify wildlife through acoustic signatures
Study the impact of urban noise on garden ecosystems
Develop automated species identification algorithms

title: Dragonfly Survey
text: Targeted dragonfly and damselfly surveys are conducted around the pond areas and water features in the Nature Discovery Garden to monitor Odonata diversity.

title: Dragonfly Survey
text: Targeted dragonfly and damselfly surveys are conducted around the pond areas and water features in the Nature Discovery Garden to monitor Odonata diversity.

title: Dragonfly Survey

Monitor dragonfly and damselfly species diversity
Assess pond ecosystem health
Document breeding activity and larval development
Track the success of pond habitat creation

title: Butterfly Transect
text: Weekly butterfly transect surveys follow standardized UK Butterfly Monitoring Scheme protocols to monitor butterfly populations in the Nature Discovery Garden.

title: Creativity in Design
text: A collaboration with City St George focusing on exploring creative design approaches to urban nature spaces and developing innovative solutions for biodiversity conservation in urban environments.

title: Creativity in Design
text: A collaboration with City St George focusing on exploring creative design approaches to urban nature spaces and developing innovative solutions for biodiversity conservation in urban environments.

title: Creativity in Design
text:
Objectives

Integrate design thinking with ecological research
Develop creative solutions for urban biodiversity challenges
Foster interdisciplinary collaboration between design and ecology
Create innovative approaches to public engagement with nature

title: Environmental DNA
text: Environmental DNA (eDNA) sampling is used to detect and monitor biodiversity in the Nature Discovery Garden by analyzing genetic material present in environmental samples.

title: Environmental DNA
text: Environmental DNA (eDNA) sampling is used to detect and monitor biodiversity in the Nature Discovery Garden by analyzing genetic material present in environmental samples.

title: Environmental DNA
text:
Objectives

Detect species presence through DNA analysis of soil and water samples
Monitor biodiversity changes over time
Identify cryptic species that may be missed by traditional survey methods
Complement traditional ecological survey techniques

title: More than Human Community Toolkit
text: A collaboration with Goldsmiths focusing on developing tools and methods for engaging communities in more-than-human research and fostering connections between people and nature.

title: Sensor Network
text: The sensor network project involves deploying environmental monitoring sensors throughout the Nature Discovery Garden to collect real-time data on various environmental parameters.

title: Sensor Network
text: The sensor network project involves deploying environmental monitoring sensors throughout the Nature Discovery Garden to collect real-time data on various environmental parameters.

title: Sensor Network
text:
Objectives

Monitor environmental conditions continuously
Collect data on temperature, humidity, air quality, and other parameters
Provide data for research and public engagement
Support evidence-based garden management decisions
